title: What's News --  Business & Finance
text:
New York City employers are starting to divulge more details about salaries ahead of a law taking effect this week that will require nearly all new job postings to include a pay range, a move expected to reshape workplaces and how companies hire.

---

Emerson is selling a majority stake in its climate-technologies business to Blackstone for $14 billion including debt, in what would rank as the biggest private-equity buyout in months.

---

Twitter drafted plans for broad layoffs as new boss Elon Musk fired top executives "for cause" and sought to reassure users and advertisers about content moderation.

---

Natural-gas prices have fallen more than 40% since hitting shale-era highs in late August, reducing the risk of outsize consumer heating bills this winter and potentially easing a major cost pressure for manufacturers.

---

TuSimple, a U.S.-based self-driving trucking company, faces federal probes into whether it improperly financed and transferred technology to a Chinese startup.

---

Foxconn is scrambling to contain a weekslong Covid-19 outbreak at an iPhone factory in China during a crucial period for smartphone orders.

---

Taylor Swift's newest album marked her biggest debut yet as fans snapped up a record number of vinyl LPs.
